com.mordoch.chemtools.formulatools

Class Equation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mordoch.chemtools.formulatools.Equation

  • public class Equation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts a container for Formula objects that represent a chemical equation. Theoretically, this class can hold as many Formula objects as there is address space, so I've set the limit to 10 reactants and products.
    Since:
    0.7-alpha
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ariel Mordoch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Equation()
      Default constructor, constructs and equation representing photosynthesis.
      Equation(java.util.List<Formula> listOfReactants, java.util.List<Formula> listOfProducts, double activation_energy)
      This constructor should be used when creating a chemical equation via declaration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Equation

        public Equation()
        Default constructor, constructs and equation representing photosynthesis.

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.util.List<Formula> listOfReactants,
                java.util.List<Formula> listOfProducts,
                double activation_energy)
        This constructor should be used when creating a chemical equation via declaration. All Lists should have type Formula.
        Parameters:
        listOfReactants - a List representing the individual formulas contained in a chemical equation.
        listOfProducts - a List representing the individual products contains in a chemical equation.
        activation_energy - insiginificant for now
